w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach basic nouns around us by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases: noun, person, place, thing, animal, house, school, What people live/work at home/school, What things are in a house/sch
ool, What animals are in a house/school, What place is this
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for nouns around us
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: noun, person, place, thing, animal
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about nouns around us!”
Sing/chant the song with your teacher
Sing/chant the song to your student. Encourage them to join in the second time. Explain that they are going to be learning about nouns today.
Have the child repeat the word. Briefly show that a noun is a person (circle the baby), an animal (circle the lion), a place (circle the zoo), and

A noun is a person, place, thing, or animal.
